intro: Trisyngyne flaviramea, commonly known as the yellow-flowered syngyne, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
